00037 /**
00038  * \file variableP.h
00039  * \brief Private declarations for \ref Variable module.
00040  *
00041  * $Source: /usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/modules/variableP.h,v $
00042  * $Revision: 1.17 $ 
00043  * $Date: 2006/09/22 02:16:52 $
00044  */
00045 
00046 #ifndef _FC_VARIABLE_P_H_
00047 #define _FC_VARIABLE_P_H_
00048 
00049 #ifdef __cplusplus
00050 extern "C" {
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 // include these in basic data structures to simplify includes for the
00054 // the rest of the library which won't ever use them
00055 #include "tableP.h"
00056 #include "fileio.h"
00057 #include "fileioP.h"
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
00061  * \brief Variable Slot Structure for the Variable Table
00062  *
00063  * \description
00064  * 
00065  *   This structure contains meta data and big data for a variable.
00066  *   First, it contains a header, a handle to the owning mesh,
00067  *   and a structure containing file IO info. In addition, it
00068  *   has the data for the variable.
00069  *
00070  * \todo? There is duplication between the mesh being NULL and
00071  *   and the assoc being FC_AT_DATASET. Is this fixable? 
00072  *   Maybe we don't need the FC_AT_DATASET version?
00073  */
00074 typedef struct {
00075   _FC_SlotHeader header;  /**< Header, which contains general purpose info. */
00076   FC_Dataset ds;      /**< Handle to the owning dataset. */
00077   FC_Mesh mesh;       /**< Handle to the owning mesh. If this is a global
00078                  variable, this will be FC_NULL_MESH. */
00079   FC_Sequence sequence; /**< Handle to owning sequence (can be NULL) */
00080   int stepID;      /**< ID of step in a sequence, -1 if sequence == NULL */
00081   //---File reference
00082   _FC_VarFileIOInfo fileInfo; /**< Holds info pertinent to file access. */
00083    //---About the variable:  data
00084   int numDataPoint;   /**< The number of data points (should match the number 
00085                 of the mesh subentities of the data association type 
00086                          (e.g. should be the number vertices, or elements, 
00087                          etc.). */
00088   int numComponent;   /**< The number of components for each data point. E.g.
00089                           2 for a vector with x and y components or 9 for
00090                           a 3X3 tensor. */
00091   FC_AssociationType assoc;  /**< The subentities of the mesh that the data is 
00092                              associated with (e.g. vertices, elements, etc). */
00093   FC_MathType mathtype; /**< Mathematical ordering of the components of a 
00094                             a data point. E.g. scalar, vector, tensor, etc. */
00095   FC_DataType datatype;  /**< The data type of data (e.g. int, float, etc.) */
00096   void *data;   /**< Void pointer to the data which will be ordered 1st by 
00097              the data point, then by the component (e.g. xyzxyz ...). */
00098 } _FC_VarSlot;
00099 
00100 // slot
00101 void _fc_initVarSlot(_FC_VarSlot* varSlot);
00102 void _fc_releaseVarSlot(_FC_VarSlot *varSlot);
00103 void _fc_clearVarSlot(_FC_VarSlot *varSlot);
00104 
00105 // table access
00106 int _fc_getVarTableSize(void);
00107 _FC_VarSlot* _fc_getVarSlot(FC_Variable variable);
00108 _FC_VarSlot* _fc_getVarSlotFromID(int varID);
00109 _FC_VarSlot* _fc_getNewVarSlot(void);
00110 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteVarSlot(FC_Variable variable);
00111 void _fc_printVarTable(char *label);
00112 void  _fc_freeVarTable(void);
00113 
00114 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getNextComponentExtension(
00115                  unsigned int *state,
00116                  unsigned int *last_col_in_row, 
00117                  unsigned int *last_col_in_search,
00118                  char *extension);
00119 
00120 #ifdef __cplusplus
00121 }
00122 #endif
00123 
00124 #endif // _FC_VARIABLE_P_H_
